meanings.def: a person that you do not know
examples: There was a complete stranger sitting at my desk.
They got on well together although they were total strangers.
Why should a perfect (= complete) stranger ever help me out?
We've told our daughter not to speak to strangers.
stranger to somebody She remained a stranger to me.
He was a complete stranger to me.
His years abroad had made him almost a stranger with his family.
She said that I would meet a mysterious stranger.
He was tired of being accosted by strangers in the street.

meanings.def: a person who is in a place that they have not been in before
examples: Sorry, I don't know where the bank is. I'm a stranger here myself.
stranger to… He must have been a stranger to the town.
You're a stranger here, aren't you?
She was a stranger to the place.

meanings.def: to be familiar/not familiar with something because you have/have not experienced it many times before
examples: He is no stranger to controversy.

idioms.def: to be familiar/not familiar with something because you have/have not experienced it many times before
examples: He is no stranger to controversy.
